active_alerts.title: Bowdoin Escalator 125 (Lobby to street) is unavailable until further notice.
active_alerts.description:
The escalator will remain out of service for the foreseeable future. This decision was made after a thorough inspection determined that corrosion on the escalator’s steel truss was so severe that it could not be repaired further and that a complete replacement of the escalator would be required. Replacing the escalator at this location requires a more extended unit meeting modern escalator safety requirements. This longer unit will require significant alteration to the station entrance to meet code requirements. The MBTA has currently begun design work to understand what station upgrades will be needed. 
  
Due to these complexities, we expect the escalator will remain out of service for a significant time. We recognize the challenges this poses to our riders, and please know we are working to identify a solution as quickly as possible. In the meantime, Government Center Station, which is fully accessible and serves the Blue Line, is under a quarter-mile from Bowdoin Station.

Malden Center Escalator 312 (Street level to Commuter Rail platform) unavailable due to maintenance.
There is no accessible path connecting the inb. & outb. platforms at Wellesley Sq Sta. The existing path includes steep slopes & is long.
active_alerts.description: There are accessible mini-high platforms at the Western end of both the Track 1 and Track 2 sides. However, the existing pedestrian path between the two sides is long and includes steep slopes, especially on the Crest Road bridge over the tracks. Designs are underway to provide for a fully compliant pathway.

active_alerts.title: Route 220 has resumed operating to the Hingham Ferry Terminal. For information on ferry arrival and departure times visit mbta.com/Ferry
Park St Elevator 808 (Red Line center platform to Government Center & North platform, Winter St Concourse) unavailable through Sun Oct 5
active_alerts.description:
The elevator will be closed for major equipment upgrades that will significantly improve the long-term reliability of this elevator.

To exit: from the Red Line Center platform, take Park Street Elevator 979 to the Green Line Copley & West platform. Exit faregates. Take Elevator 978 to the Boston Common. 

To Red Line: from street level, take Park Street Elevator 978 on the Boston Common to the Green Line Copley & West lobby. Enter faregates. Turn left. Take Elevator 979 to the Red Line center platform. \n\n

To Red Line: from Winter St Concourse, go to the end of the Green Line Gov Ctr & North platform. Use Elevator 812. Turn left. Take Elevator 823 to the Copley & West platform. Go to the east end of the platform. Take Elevator 979 to the Red Line center platform.

active_alerts.title: Rts. 62 & 76 are now operating as separate Rts., with more frequent service on both. Rt. 62 now runs every day.
active_alerts.description:
Routes 62 & 76: Bedford VA Hospital – Alewife Station, Hanscom Airport, and Lincoln Lab:

If you ride the combined Route 62/76:
The combined 62/76 route pattern will be discontinued, ending Saturday service to Lincoln Lab and all service on Hartwell Ave in Lexington.

For weekday service between Lexington Center, Hanscom Field, and Lincoln Lab, use Route 76.
For Saturday service between Lexington Center, Hanscom Field, and Lincoln Lab, use an alternative travel option.
On Hartwell Ave in Lexington, use Route 62 or an alternative travel option.

If you ride Route 62:
You'll have more frequent service, every day of the week. There won't be any changes to the route.

Route 62 will run every day, with weekend service on both Saturday and Sunday.
On weekdays during peak hours (7 – 9 AM and 4 – 6:30 PM), a Route 62 bus will arrive every 30 minutes, compared to 45 minutes today.

On weekdays during peak hours, between Alewife and Lexington Center, a 62 or 76 bus will arrive every 15 – 30 minutes.

On weekends, a Route 62 bus will arrive every 50 minutes, compared to 65 minutes on the 62/76 today. 
Trips between the Bedford VA Hospital and Alewife will be 15 – 20 minutes shorter.

If you ride Route 76:
Route 76 will continue to run on weekdays only, with more frequent service during peak hours (7 – 9 AM and 4 – 6:30 PM). There won't be any changes to the route.

During peak hours, a Route 76 bus will arrive every 30 minutes, compared to 45 minutes today.
During peak hours, between Alewife and Lexington Center, a 62 or 76 bus will arrive every 15 – 30 minutes.
Route 76 will run new midday and evening service.

As of Mon, Aug 25, further schedule adjustments will be implemented on the Franklin/Foxboro Ln reflecting the progress made by Amtrak repair
active_alerts.description:
Train service will resume between Forge Park/495 station and Franklin Station, with inbound trains originating at Forge Park as previously scheduled.

Foxboro Line trains 1765 and 1770 will now complete their trips to Foxboro Station.

Franklin/Foxboro outbound trains will operate closer to a regular schedule with minor adjustments to allow four trains to make an additional stop at Hyde Park Station, adding approximately three minutes to the schedule and an additional five minutes to the last stop of all outbound trains.

Franklin/Foxboro inbound trains will continue to run via the Fairmount Line and will not stop at Ruggles or Back Bay Station. An additional five minutes will be added to the last stop of some inbound evening Franklin/Foxboro trains.

Mid-day busing between Walpole and Foxboro will continue, as will the cancellation of the mid-day Foxboro trains.

Train 744 (1:59PM Readville) will have a minor schedule adjustment with a three-minute later departure time and three-minute later arrival time, as a result of the changes to the Franklin/Foxboro Line.

The Fairmount Line schedule will be adjusted to accommodate a midday Franklin/Foxboro train (train 744) running as a local via the Fairmount Line.

Shuttle buses will continue to replace service between Foxboro and Walpole on weekdays between 9:30 a.m. and 2:30 p.m. to allow for construction of a permanent, accessible platform at Foxboro Station. Special event trains for concerts and Patriots games at Gillette Stadium will continue to operate during construction.
